tool.name: RRules Parser
tool.command: python -m rrparser #if str($rules.type) != "other": --rule-type '$rules.type' #else: --rules-file '$rules.file' #end if --diameters '$diameters' --outfile '$output' #if str($output_format) == "tar": --output-format "tar.gz" #else: --output-format '$output_format' #end if

param.name: diameters
param.label: Select the diameters of the reactions rules

tool.help:
RRulesParser ============
Retrieve the reaction rules from `RetroRules <https://retrorules.org/>`_
Input -----
* **rules-file**: (string) Filename of reaction rules * **rule-type**: (string) Valid options: retro, forward, all. Return the rules that are in reverse, forward or both direction * **diameters**: (integer list) Valid options: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16. The diameter of the rules to return * **outdir**: (string) Path where output files will be written * **outfile**: (string) Path where output files will be written * **output-format**: (string) Valid options: csv, tar.gz. Format of the returned file
Ouput -----
* **output**: (string): Path of the output file. Either a compressed tar.gz (containing a csv) or csv list of reaction rules that are in a RetroPath2.0 friendly format

v1.0.0
